DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Corticosteroid Agent Administration Dose Units
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The units used to represent the dose of a steroid/corticosteroid.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Corticosteroid Agent Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation)._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Units Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Concomitant Medication Dose Units terminology._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

Concepts.definition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to use active NCIt. mc 2/8/19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to a metered dose of medicinal substance(s) that is delivered in uniform quantity upon each activation of a medical device (e.g. an inhaler), in which the dosage form is contained.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a puff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of medicinal substance(s) contained in a single item of a tablet dosage form comprising of compressed medicinal substance(s) with or without suitable diluents.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a tablet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.
